cause.description:
Artists Against Hunger & Poverty (AAHP) is WHY's program that enlists performing artists to help raise funds and awareness for the most innovative and effective community-based organizations working to combat hunger and poverty. WHY offers artists, record labels, managers, agents and fan clubs an opportunity to take a stand by using their voices and resources effectively — while doing what they already do so well.
1. 38 million Americans, including 14 million children, are hungry or food insecure.
2. 25 million Americans relied on soup kitchens, food pantries, and food banks for food for themselves and their families in 2005. That includes 9 million children and 3 million senior citizens.
3. 852 million people in the world are hungry.
4. 1.3 billion people live on less than $1 a day.
5. Hunger is NOT an option.
cause.mission: WHY forges relationships between artists and grassroots organizations to raise funds and public awareness.
cause.name: Artists Against Hunger & Poverty
